name: Javier Coronado
themes: Belonging, Cultural Representation, Identity & Discrimination, Academic Difficulty, Peer Relationships, Work-Life Balance
description: Javier Coronado, a Mexican-American first-generation student, shares his challenging experiences with racism and the need to constantly prove himself in his engineering studies. He discusses the impact of his cultural background on his academic journey, the difficulties in balancing his graduate school commitments with family time, and the lack of understanding and openness to different cultures in the program.
